Name: Storage and Retention Timing
Description:
Ensure that the data-retention and disposal policies, procedures, and processes are implemented as follows: 
data storage amount and retention time is limited to that required for legal, regulatory, and/or business requirements.

Name: Cardholder Data Deletion
Description:
Ensure that the data-retention and disposal policies, procedures, and processes are implemented as follows:
The defined processes are in place for securely deleting cardholder data when no longer needed for legal, regulatory, and/or business reasons.

Name: Retention Requirements
Description:
Ensure that the data-retention and disposal policies, procedures, and processes implemented as follows: 
There is a specific retention requirement(s) for cardholder data.
  For example, cardholder data needs to be held for X period for Y business reasons.

Name: Quarterly Process for Reviewing Retention
Description:
Ensure that the data-retention and disposal policies, procedures, and processes implemented as follows: 
There is a quarterly process for identifying and securely deleting stored cardholder data that exceeds defined retention requirements.

Name: Meet the Requirements for Retention
Description:
Ensure that the data-retention and disposal policies, procedures, and processes implemented as follows: 
All stored cardholder data meet the requirements defined in the data-retention policy.

Name: Verification Code Storage
Description: For all paper storage, the card verification code or value (three-digit or four-digit number printed on the front or back of a payment card) shall not be stored after authorization.

Name: Storage Policies and Procedures
Description:
Ensure that security policies and operational procedures for protecting stored cardholder data are:
 - Documented 
 - In use 
 - Known to all affected parties.

Name: Media Physically Secured
Description:
Ensure that all media are physically secured (including but not limited to computers, removable electronic media, paper receipts, paper reports, and faxes).

 For purposes of Requirement 9, media refers to all paper and electronic media containing cardholder data

Name: Media Destruction
Description: Ensure that all media is destroyed when it is no longer needed for business or legal reasons.

Name: Media Destruction - Hardcopy Materials
Description:
Ensure that the media destruction is performed as follows: 
Hardcopy materials cross-cut shredded, incinerated, or pulped so that cardholder data cannot be reconstructed.

Name: Media Destruction - Storage Containers
Description:
Ensure that the media destruction is performed as follows: 
Storage containers used for materials that contain information to be destroyed secured to prevent access to the contents.

Name: List of Devices
Description:
Ensure that the devices that capture payment card data via direct physical interaction with the card protected against tampering and substitution as follows: 
The policies and procedures shall require that a list of such devices be maintained. 
 Note: This requirement applies to card-reading devices used in card-present transactions (that is, card swipe or dip) at the point of sale. This requirement is not intended to apply to manual key-entry components such as computer keyboards and POS keypads.

Name: Periodically Inspected
Description:
Ensure that the devices that capture payment card data via direct physical interaction with the card protected against tampering and substitution as follows: 
The policies and procedures shall require that devices are periodically inspected to look for tampering or substitution.  
 Note: This requirement applies to card-reading devices used in card-present transactions (that is, card swipe or dip) at the point of sale. This requirement is not intended to apply to manual key-entry components such as computer keyboards and POS keypads.

Name: Personnel Trained
Description:
Ensure that the devices that capture payment card data via direct physical interaction with the card protected against tampering and substitution as follows: 
The policies and procedures shall require that personnel are trained to be aware of suspicious behavior and to report tampering or substitution of devices. 
 Note: This requirement applies to card-reading devices used in card-present transactions (that is, card swipe or dip) at the point of sale. This requirement is not intended to apply to manual key-entry components such as computer keyboards and POS keypads.

Name: Inventory
Description:
The list of devices shall include the following:
 - Make, model of device 
 - Location of device (for example, the address of the site or facility where the device is located) 
 - Device serial number or other method of unique identification

Name: Accurate and Up-to-Date
Description: The list of devices shall be kept accurate and up to date.

Name: Updated when Added, Relocated, or Decommissioned
Description: The list of devices shall be updated when devices are added, relocated, decommissioned, etc.

Name: Device Surfaces Inspected
Description:
The device surfaces shall be periodically inspected to detect tampering (for example, addition of card skimmers to devices), or substitution (for example, by checking the serial number or other device characteristics to verify it has not been swapped with a fraudulent device) as follows:
 (9.9.2(a), Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard, Self-Assessment Questionnaire B and Attestation of Compliance, Verions 3.2)
 Note: Examples of signs that a device might have been tampered with or substituted include unexpected attachments or cables plugged into the device, missing or changed security labels, broken or differently colored casing, or changes to the serial number or other external markings.

Name: Personnel Aware of Procedures for Inspections
Description: The personnel shall be aware of procedures for inspecting devices.

Name: Training Topics
Description:
The personnel shall be trained to be aware of attempted tampering or replacement of devices, to include the following: 
The training materials for personnel at point-of-sale locations shall include the following: 
 - Verify the identity of any third-party persons claiming to be repair or maintenance personnel, prior to granting them access to modify or troubleshoot devices. 
 - Do not install, replace, or return devices without verification. 
 - Be aware of suspicious behavior around devices (for example, attempts by unknown persons to unplug or open devices). 
 - Report suspicious behavior and indications of device tampering or substitution to appropriate personnel (for example, to a manager or security officer).

Name: Point-of-Sale Location Trainings on Detecting and Reporting Attempted Tampering
Description:
The personnel trained to be aware of attempted tampering or replacement of devices shall include the following: 
The personnel at point-of-sale locations shall have received training, and they shall be aware of procedures to detect and report attempted tampering or replacement of devices.

Name: Restricting Physical Access Policies and Procedures
Description:
The security policies and operational procedures for restricting physical access to cardholder data shall be: 
 - Documented 
 - In use 
 - Known to all affected parties.

Name: Security Policies
Description: The security policy shall be established, published, maintained, and disseminated to all relevant personnel.

Name: Security Policies Reviewed
Description: The security policy shall be reviewed at least annually and updated when the environment changes.

Name: Security Responsibilities
Description: The security policy and procedures shall clearly define information security responsibilities for all personnel.

Name: Incident Response and Escalation Procedures
Description:
The following information security management responsibilities shall be formally assigned to an individual or team: 
Establishing, documenting, and distributing security incident response and escalation procedures to ensure timely and effective handling of all situations.

Name: Security Awareness Program
Description: A formal security awareness program shall be in place to make all personnel aware of the cardholder data security policy and procedures.

Name: List of Service Providers
Description:
The policies and procedures shall be maintained and implemented to manage service providers with whom cardholder data is shared, or that could affect the security of cardholder data, as follows:  
A list of service providers maintained, including a description of the service(s) provided.

Name: Written Agreements Maintained
Description:
The policies and procedures shall be maintained and implemented to manage service providers with whom cardholder data is shared, or that could affect the security of cardholder data, as follows: 
A written agreement shall be maintained that includes an acknowledgement that the service providers are responsible for the security of cardholder data the service providers possess or otherwise store, process, or transmit on behalf of the customer, or to the extent that they could impact the security of the customers cardholder data environment.  
 Note: The exact wording of an acknowledgement will depend on the agreement between the two parties, the details of the service being provided, and the responsibilities assigned to each party. The acknowledgement does not have to include the exact wording provided in this requirement.

Name: Established Process for Engaging Service Providers
Description:
The policies and procedures shall be maintained and implemented to manage service providers with whom cardholder data is shared, or that could affect the security of cardholder data, as follows: 
An established process for engaging service providers, including proper due diligence prior to engagement.

Name: Monitor Service Providers
Description:
The policies and procedures shall be maintained and implemented to manage service providers with whom cardholder data is shared, or that could affect the security of cardholder data, as follows: 
A program shall be maintained to monitor service providers PCI DSS compliance status at least annually.

Name: PCI DSS Requirements Managed by Service Providers
Description:
The policies and procedures shall be maintained and implemented to manage service providers with whom cardholder data is shared, or that could affect the security of cardholder data, as follows: 
Information shall be maintained about which PCI DSS requirements are managed by each service provider, and which are managed by the entity.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: Create an incident response plan to be implemented in the event of system breach.
